intro: Physeterostemon jardimii, commonly known as the Jardimii physeterostemon, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its square stems, opposite leaves, and showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
